lead_paragraph: Bitter conflicts have erupted between insurers and consumers at hearings around the country as companies request double-digit premium increases.

headline.print_headline: Health Insurers Use Reviews, Intended to Constrain Rate Jumps, to Justify Them
headline.main: Health Insurers Use Process Intended to Curb Rate Increases to Justify Them

snippet: Bitter conflicts have erupted between insurers and consumers at hearings around the country as companies request double-digit premium increases....
abstract: Health insurers across country are using review process, originally intended to discourage extraordinary jumps in health insurance rates, to illustrate how they are losing money under Affordable Care Act and to explain their reasons for raising premiums in 2017; contentious fights between insurers and consumers are on view at hearings nationwide.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Blue Cross and Blue Shield Assn
